meanings.def: the direction that is on your right when you watch the sun rise; one of the four main points of the compass
examples: Which way is south?
warmer weather coming from the south
to the south (of…) He lives to the south of (= further south than) the city.
views of distant mountains to north and south

meanings.def: the southern part of a country, a region or the world
examples: birds flying to the south for the winter
in the south Houses are less expensive in the North than in the South (= of the country).
They bought a villa in the South of France.

meanings.def: the southern states of the US
examples: The South used to rely heavily on agriculture.

meanings.def: the poorer countries in the southern half of the world
examples: The South comprises many diverse countries.
the vast informal economies of the Global South
South Wales
They live on the south coast.
The bridge connects the north and south banks of the river.
The south side of the house gets very hot in summer.
The guests will proceed through the south door of the chapel.

meanings.def: a south wind blows from the south
examples: A mild south wind blew all day.
This room faces south.
The train was heading south to Marseilles.

meanings.def: nearer to the south than something
examples: They live ten miles south of Bristol.
The drug is achieving revenues just south of $1 billion per quarter.
Interest rates will end somewhere south of 6.5%.

meanings.def: to or in the south of a country
examples: They've gone to live down south.

idioms.def: to or in the south of a country
examples: They've gone to live down south.
